New Records: Travis Head smashed his 50 off just 19 balls to set a new Australian record against England in T20 internationals
Key Match Events: Travis Head smashed the fastest ever T20I half-century by an Australian batter against England off just 19 balls
Travis Head was dismissed for 59 off 23 after the visitors had been put in by stand-in captain Phil Salt
Liam Livingstone (3-22) and Adil Rashid (1-23) started England's impressive repair job
Australia's bowlers got England all out 29 runs short of victory
Post-Match Reflections: Mitchell Marsh has hailed the'special' talent of three of his Australian matchwinners as Travis Head, Adam Zampa and Josh Hazlewood combined expertly to sink a new-look England
Miscellaneous Highlights: Australia and England play their next T20 match on Saturday at 3:30am (AEST)
Australia drew first blood in the three-match T20 series which continues in Cardiff on Saturday morning (AEST)
Others: Tim David made up for his golden duck with an astonishing running catch off Xavier Bartlett at deep mid-on to get rid of Jordan Cox
